title: Falling for Johnny
features: Friendship between a teenage girl and a Whitey Bulger-like crime boss becomes dangerous when she discovers his true identity. Riley Donavan doesn't know that her father is a bookie. She thinks her mother's death was an accident. Riley doesn't realize that the nice old gentleman named Johnny, whom she sits on a bench with each morning, is the ruthless crime boss responsible for her mother's death. Over time, Johnny becomes a father figure to Riley. Johnny is drawn to Riley because she resembles his lost daughter. Riley's curiosity leads her to discover Johnny's true identity. In the end, she must summon the strength to free herself, from both the harassment of a teenage punk, and the protection of a self-deluded killer. Inspired by the Boston underworld and the notorious mob boss James "Whitey" Bulger.
description: "McLennan ably handles her characters and their crises, though her skill as a writer is most evident in the novel's third part, when the plot keenly unfurls. With moral ambiguity and questionable intentions, the cast lends a disconcerting air to McLennan's solid debut.
A dark, violent story with a heart

Alison (Johnson) McLennan is a native of  Quincy, Massachusetts. She earned a Bachelor of University Studies Degree in Expressive Therapy with a minor in Creative Writing from the University of Utah.   She completed her MFA at The Solstice Program of Pine Manor College where she was awarded a fellowship for Fiction.
is her first novel. It won an Honorable Mention in the 2012 Utah Original Writing Competition. She currently resides in Utah where she is working on another novel.
